original_title: NCCSL workshop on Market Research Insights and Analytics for Business Competitiveness
original_body_lines: The National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka (NCCSL) recently concluded a comprehensive workshop titled “Market Research Insights and Analytics for Business Competitiveness” on November 7, 2024, at the National Chamber Auditorium. The event attracted participants from diverse industries, including entrepreneurs, brand management, marketers, and business development professionals, all aiming to enhance their strategic approaches through effective market research. The workshop focused on understanding market opportunities and consumer behavior, offering hands-on experience in designing research processes and using advanced technology for data analysis.

Waruna Kathriarachchi, an expert with over 25 years in market research and a former Director at Nielsen Sri Lanka, served as the lead presenter. His session covered crucial topics such as analyzing consumer behavior, understanding the market landscape, and applying data-driven insights for competitive advantage. Through practical applications, he demonstrated how businesses can leverage market research for sustained growth. A team from Crowdsnap provided data analysis expertise using customized AI tools which can be used by individuals in their internal market research requirements.

Complementing the session Ms. Niroshini Kathiravel, an experienced qualitative researcher and Brand Strategist at Unilever Sri Lanka, conducted an insightful session on qualitative research. She emphasized the importance of understanding consumer sentiments and using qualitative analysis to create an overall view of market dynamics, equipping attendees with effective methods for capturing consumer insights. Participants found the workshop’s blend of qualitative and quantitative research techniques highly valuable. The NCCSL continues its commitment to empowering Sri Lankan businesses with knowledge-based workshops that foster growth and innovation through robust market research strategies.

Feedback from participants underscored the value of both the qualitative and quantitative research techniques covered. The NCCSL remains dedicated to offering knowledge-driven workshops that empower Sri Lankan businesses. With a strong emphasis on market research, the Chamber continues to support companies in their journey towards growth and innovation.

Further, The National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka intends to offer research consultancy services tailored to the MSME sector enterprises, helping them make more informed decisions and stay competitive. These research services will focus on challenges which MSMEs face, such as market entry, competitive analysis, digital adoption, and customer preference shifts. This customization can help MSMEs find actionable strategies within their resource constraints.
